asym_id.description: Asymmetric chain identifier for the container.

assembly_id.description: This item references an assembly in pdbx_struct_assembly.

interface_partner_index.description: This item references an interface partner array index.

provenance_source.description: A name for the provenance source.

enum: covalent modification of a nucleotide base
covalent modification of a nucleotide phosphate
covalent modification of a nucleotide sugar

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Active site
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Amino acid(s) directly involved in the activity of an enzyme

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Binding site
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Binding site for any chemical group (co-enzyme, prosthetic group, etc.)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Calcium binding
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Position(s) of calcium binding region(s) within the protein (e.g. EF-hand)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Chain
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Extent of a polypeptide chain in the mature protein following processing or proteolytic cleavage

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Compositional bias
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Homopolymeric stretches and large regions of compositional bias in the protein

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Cross-link
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Residues participating in covalent linkage(s) between proteins

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: DNA binding
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Experimentally determined and conserved DNA-binding domains defined by the InterPro resources PROSITE, Pfam and SMART (the AP2/ERF domain, the ETS domain, the Fork-Head domain, etc.)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Domain
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Modular protein domains which are self-stabilizing and fold independently of the rest of the protein chain

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Glycosylation
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Covalently attached glycan group(s) (mono-, di-, or polysaccharide)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Initiator methionine
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Cleavage of the initiator methionine from the mature protein

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Lipidation
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Covalently attached lipid group(s)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Metal binding
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Binding site for a metal ion

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Modified residue
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Modified residues excluding lipids, glycans and protein cross-links

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Mutagenesis
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Site which has been experimentally altered by mutagenesis

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Non-adjacent residues
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Indicates that two residues in a sequence are not consecutive and that there is an undetermined number of unsequenced residues between them

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Non-terminal residue
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Indicates that a residue is not the terminal residue of the complete protein (the sequence is incomplete)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Nucleotide binding
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Nucleotide phosphate binding region

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Peptide
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Extent of an active peptide in the mature protein

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Propeptide
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Part of a protein that is cleaved during maturation or activation

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Region of interest
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Region of interest in the sequence (e.g. different regions in multifunctional enzymes or fusion proteins)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Repeat
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Denotes the positions of repeated sequence motifs or repeated domains

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Non-standard residue
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Occurrences of non-standard amino acids (selenocysteine and pyrrolysine) in the protein sequence

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Sequence conflict
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Description of sequence discrepancies of unknown origin

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Natural variant
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Description of a natural variant of the protein (polymorphisms, disease-associated mutations, RNA editing events, etc.)

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Motif
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Short (up to 20 amino acids) sequence motif of biological interest

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Signal peptide
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Sequence targeting proteins to the secretory pathway or periplasmic space

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Site
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Any interesting single amino acid site on the sequence

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Alternative sequence
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Amino acid change(s) producing alternate protein isoforms

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Topological domain
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Location of non-membrane regions of membrane-spanning proteins

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Transit peptide
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Extent of a transit peptide for organelle targeting

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Transmembrane
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Extent of a membrane-spanning region

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Sequence uncertainty
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Describes region(s) of a sequence for which the authors are unsure about the sequence assignment

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Zinc finger
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Denotes the position(s) and type(s) of zinc fingers within the protein

rcsb_enum_annotated.name: Intramembrane
rcsb_enum_annotated.detail: Extent of a region located in a membrane without crossing it

beg_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature begins.

end_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature ends.

value.description: The value for the feature over this monomer segment.

values.description: The value(s) for the feature over this monomer segment.
